revision.comment: Rescuing 1 sources and tagging 0 as dead.) #IABot (v2.0
revision.text:
{{short description|Wikipedia list article}} The following table is a '''list of successful and unsuccessful Mars landers'''. As of 2018, 16 lander missions and 5 sub-landers (Rovers and Penetrators) attempted to land on Mars. Of 16 landers, only [[InSight|InSight Mars Lander]] is currently in operation on Mars. This list excludes [[Mars rover|rovers]], such as Spirit (''[[Mars Exploration Rover]]-A''), Opportunity (Mars ''Exploration Rover-B'') and Curiosity (''Mars Science Laboratory''). ==Mars landers== {| class="wikitable" |+Table consisting of list of Mars landers !S.No !Landers !Launch Date !Landing Date !Mass (kg){{cite arxiv |last=M |first=Malaya Kumar Biswal |last2=A |first2=Ramesh Naidu |date=2018-08-23 |title=A Novel Entry, Descent and Landing Architecture for Mars Landers |eprint=1809.00062 |class=physics.pop-ph}} ![[Landing]] Site !Region !Status !MOLA !Entry Velocity !References |- |1. |2MV-3 No.1 |04 Nov 1962 |25 Nov 1962 |890 | - | - |Failed | - | - |{{cite document |doi=10.13140/RG.2.2.13568.07682 |title=Comparative EDL Summary of Mars Landers |last1=Biswal.m |first1=Malaya Kumar |last2=Annavarapu |first2=Ramesh Naidu |year=2019 }} |- |2. |[[Mars 2]] |19 May 1971 |27 Nov 1971 |1210 |45°S 47°E♦ | - |Failed | - | - |{{Cite web |url=https://nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov/nmc/spacecraft/display.action?id=1971-045A |title=NASA - NSSDCA - Spacecraft - Details |website=nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov |access-date=2019-01-13}}Perminov, V. G. (1999). The difficult road to Mars: a brief history of Mars exploration in the Soviet Union. |- |3. |[[Mars 3]] |28 May 1971 |02 Dec 1971 |1210 |45°S 202°E♦ |[[Terra Sirenum|Sirenum Terra]] |Partial Success | - | - |{{Cite web |url=https://nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov/nmc/spacecraft/display.action?id=1971-049F |title=NASA - NSSDCA - Spacecraft - Details |website=nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov |access-date=2019-01-13}} |- |4. |[[Mars 6]] |05 Aug 1973 |12 Mar 1974 |635 |23.90°S 19.4°N |[[Margaritifer Terra]] |Partial Success | - | - |{{Cite web |url=https://nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov/nmc/spacecraft/display.action?id=1973-052A |title=NASA - NSSDCA - Spacecraft - Details |website=nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov |access-date=2019-01-13}} |- |5. |[[Mars 7]] |09 Aug 1973 | - |635 | - | - |Failed | - | - |{{Cite web |url=https://nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov/nmc/spacecraft/display.action?id=1973-053A |title=NASA - NSSDCA - Spacecraft - Details |website=nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov |access-date=2019-01-13}} |- |6. |[[Viking 1]] |20 Aug 1975 |20 Jul 1976 |572 |22.27°N 47.95°W |[[Chryse Planitia]] |Success | -3.5 |4.61 km/sec |{{Cite web |url=https://nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov/planetary/viking1landata.html |title=Viking 1 Lander |website=nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov |access-date=2019-01-13}} |- |7. |[[Viking 2]] |09 Sep 1975 |03 Sep 1976 |572 |47.64°N 225.71°W |[[Utopia Planitia]] |Success | -3.5 |4.61 km/sec |{{Cite web |url=https://nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov/planetary/viking2landata.html |title=Viking 2 Lander |website=nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov |access-date=2019-01-13}} |- |8. |[[Phobos program|Phobos 1]]'''§''' |07 Jul 1988 | - |5.63 km/sec |{{Cite book |title=44th AIAA/ASME/ASCE/AHS/ASC Structures, Structural Dynamics, and Materials Conference |doi=10.2514/6.2003-1902 |chapter = Parachute Subsystems for the Beagle 2 Mars Lander Entry Descent and Landing Systems |year = 2003 |last1 = Lindstrand |first1 = Per |isbn=978-1-62410-100-7}}{{Cite journal |date=1998-06-01 |title=A sophisticated lander for scientific exploration of Mars: scientific objectives and implementation of the Mars-96 Small Station |journal=Planetary and Space Science |volume=46 |issue=6–7 |pages=717–737 |doi=10.1016/S0032-0633(98)00008-7 |last1=Linkin |first1=V. |displayauthors=etal |bibcode=1998P&SS...46..717L}} |- |14. |[[Phoenix (spacecraft)|Phoenix Lander]] |04 Aug 2007 |5 May 2008 |350 |68.22°N 125.7°W |[[Vastitas Borealis]] |Success | -3.5 |5.59 km/sec | |- |15. |[[Schiaparelli EDM lander|Schiaparelli EDM]] |14 Mar 2016 |19 Oct 2016 |577 |6.208°W 2.052°S |[[Meridiani Planum]] |Partial Success |1.45 |5.83 km/sec |{{Cite web |url=https://nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov/nmc/spacecraft/display.action?id=2016-017A |title=NASA - NSSDCA - Spacecraft - Details |website=nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov |access-date=2019-01-13}} |- |16. |[[InSight|InSight Mars Lander]] |5 May 2018 |26 Nov 2018 |727 |4.5°N 135.9°E |[[Elysium Planitia]] |Operational | -2.5 |6.3 km/sec |{{Cite web |url=http://www.nasa.gov/mission_pages/insight/main/index.html |title=InSight Mars Lander {{!}} Missions |last=Greicius |first=Tony |date=2015-02-23 |website=NASA |access-date=2019-01-13}} |}
'''§''' - Spacecraft intended for Martian moons (Phobos and Deimos), '''†'''Entry Mass, ♦ Estimated, '''MOLA''' - Mars Orbiter Laser Altimeter
